positive.review: Everything. Great graphics. Easy to play. You dont need to spend money (but it does help alot). Its fun to play.

A great first version of the game. If the developers keep their current level of interaction with players, it could turn into something even greater. It does need more marketing, though, to attract new players so that the community can grow rather than shrink too soon ‚Äî because in strategy games, having a large and active player base is kind of a big deal.
good game
pretty fun
is very goode

Well after playing this for 80hrs i will say its not that pay-to-win like Other games , the element of P2W is still present but not to that extreme

I've played many of these pvp territorial strategy games.  What I like about the game are the different ways you can upgrade the Hero strengths and traits. You can level their traits to be tanks, defense, dps, farmers, etc. I like the graphics and the easy transition from phone to laptop. I believe you can be F2P easily.  There are no leveling roadblocks or paywalls. You can level Heroes by grinding the NPC monsters or using earned medallions.  There is a variety of events to play, you can grow in a small alliance, but there is an urge to join a large alliance in order to maintain the level of resources it takes to upgrade and keep up with the event tasks. I also like that you can't just pay your way to be strong (i.e. "whales").  Money does give you benefits of course, but it doesn't quickly make your Hero or your Castle the strongest. It costs a lot of money to get a little bit.  Like you can buy a package but it doesn't allow much more than maybe upgrading a building or finishing some research in your town, or it gives your hero some tokens to upgrade a skill. The growth takes a lot of time.
- One of my complaints with this game are the amount of resources it takes almost immediately, like it is rediculous how much you need to level up your buildings and your army tiers.  
- Another HUGE complaint is the lack of visibility the Tribe leaders have in their log history.  Most games will tell you what members scout or attack your alliance buildings, or when your members attack other tribes, or when your members are attacked and by whom. I had no idea who was attacking or scouting my buildings. Sometimes it would say "someone scouted a building" and that's it. Sometimes It would tell me a tribe name when my building burned, but not the player name. The leaders don't always know that their members are attacking something they shouldn't and it puts the leader in a vulnerable position when another alliance thinks it was on purpose and you can't get a straight answer from your team.  Some tribes get sabotaged by rogue players that go in just to cause trouble and wars.They seriously need to improve their Tribe Logs to be more helpful.
-The translator in the chat helps a lot overall, but still needs a little improvement with certain dialects.
- Also, IGG is terrible at not allowing you to delete characters. They will never let you do it in any of their games. It leaves a lot of waste on the servers and dead weight in the tribes. 
Overall, this game is great, it's worth a try. They have put a lot into it.
Great game. relaxing and exciting at the same time.
The Graphics are awesome, the game play is simple and easy to learn.  There are a few bugs with the chatroom censors, but overall it is a good game for anyone 16 or older.
If you like strategy and base building games this one is top notch. Complex enough to be interesting, but not so complex or stingy that it's not fun to play. There are lots of things to do in game.

It's similar to other wargames(Rise of kingdoms, Call of Dragons, Rise of Vikings, etc ) i believe you guys have played before. However, it's quite generous when it's about the rewards for you to participate in some in-game events. So it could worth playing for a while.
You can enjoy the game with only spending $5 per month on the golden moon pass.
Its a fun strategy game very similar to RoK, but yeah its p2w
Everything. Great graphics. Easy to play. You dont need to spend money (but it does help alot). Its fun to play.

A great first version of the game. If the developers keep their current level of interaction with players, it could turn into something even greater. It does need more marketing, though, to attract new players so that the community can grow rather than shrink too soon ‚Äî because in strategy games, having a large and active player base is kind of a big deal.

The game was great until their last 2 updates. Now it crashes every hour or so. Programmers get an F for screwing up this game.
Revised: after playing the game an additional 110 hours, I was able to put up with the crashing. So, it still crashes but There was enough time in between to enjoy the game.

Fate War blends city-building, strategy, and exploration in a way that feels both fresh and addictive. I really enjoyed how seasons and day-night cycles impact development, adding depth without feeling overwhelming. Battles are tactical and fun, and the roguelike expeditions keep every playthrough exciting. The mix of management, survival, and combat makes it stand out among strategy games.

nice game like viking rise

- One of my complaints with this game are the amount of resources it takes almost immediately, like it is rediculous how much you need to level up your buildings and your army tiers.

negative.review: I tried this game, hoping 2025 mobile-MMOs had finally improved. They haven‚Äôt, just gotten prettier. The graphics and hero progression are decent, but everything underneath is the usual mix of overlapping events, pay-to-win pressure, confusing rewards, whales steamrolling free-to-play players, cluttered UI, and messy systems. Yep, shiny presentation, same old mobile grind, so don‚Äôt let the polished presentation fool you! It‚Äôs still a mobile monetization machine - hook, hobby, habit. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3613184962 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3613180054

Nice animation and artwork. However, there isn't enough tutorial for learning. I can't find the buildings or features which I wanna build, research or progress. 
The game has been more boring as the longer time I spent playing.

IA character and design
P2W game
Wombo combo
There's something wrong with this mobile game. It overheats my machine.

Another pay to win game by the awful company IGG, with "free to play" mechanics that lure you in but after a bit you'll see that progress is way slower if you don't give them money and a lot of it for that matter.

Despite the character designs, the music, which is relaxing, it is not a good game to play.

Not recommended.

I tried this game, hoping 2025 mobile-MMOs had finally improved. They haven‚Äôt, just gotten prettier. The graphics and hero progression are decent, but everything underneath is the usual mix of overlapping events, pay-to-win pressure, confusing rewards, whales steamrolling free-to-play players, cluttered UI, and messy systems. Yep, shiny presentation, same old mobile grind, so don‚Äôt let the polished presentation fool you! It‚Äôs still a mobile monetization machine - hook, hobby, habit. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3613184962 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3613180054

To recap:
IGG=Profits at heart
As someone who had spent a substantial amount of money on the other game, Doomsday Last Survivors, what I will foresee changes that would happen in the next 1-2 years:-

1. Game is good at first, then, they will either remove the events that has very good rewards or nerf the rewards.
2. Free migration to all states for just $0.99. As a new player, you essentially only has 30 days to build up before you get state invaded and president taken away by plebs who has a 1-2 year headstart.
3. Hero armanent, hero device, pets
4. Server ping high and lags during cross-server

Look, I get it IGG is a listed, for profit company. However, the management should give the Dev team more freedom to work on instead of forcing the team to squeeze every bit of profit from players.

For point 1 & 2, I really don't get the change. Whales and non-whales have been protesting, and someone from Dev team promised to make a change, and yet the free migration problem was never solved. Of course, you will boost your short-term profit, but at what cost? Do you want to make 5k from a whale who plays only for one month or 5k plus potential another few k monthly so long the whale is happy to play on.
An extremely pay to win game, do not bother.

Nice animation and artwork. However, there isn't enough tutorial for learning. I can't find the buildings or features which I wanna build, research or progress. 
The game has been more boring as the longer time I spent playing.

P2W Game
The game always kick me out after 3 mins and no update fixed this issue because they ignore the problem many players are facing.
This game would be more fun if the developers enabled full screen mode.
There's something wrong with this mobile game. It overheats my machine.
Boring mobile game with pay-to-win.

IA character and design
P2W game
Wombo combo

Another pay to win game by the awful company IGG, with "free to play" mechanics that lure you in but after a bit you'll see that progress is way slower if you don't give them money and a lot of it for that matter.

Despite the character designs, the music, which is relaxing, it is not a good game to play.

Not recommended.

Nice animation and artwork. However, there isn't enough tutorial for learning. I can't find the buildings or features which I wanna build, research or progress. 
The game has been more boring as the longer time I spent playing.

P2W Game
The game always kick me out after 3 mins and no update fixed this issue because they ignore the problem many players are facing.
This game would be more fun if the developers enabled full screen mode.
There's something wrong with this mobile game. It overheats my machine.
Boring mobile game with pay-to-win.

IA character and design
P2W game
Wombo combo

Another pay to win game by the awful company IGG, with "free to play" mechanics that lure you in but after a bit you'll see that progress is way slower if you don't give them money and a lot of it for that matter.

Despite the character designs, the music, which is relaxing, it is not a good game to play.

Not recommended.

I tried this game, hoping 2025 mobile-MMOs had finally improved. They haven‚Äôt, just gotten prettier. The graphics and hero progression are decent, but everything underneath is the usual mix of overlapping events, pay-to-win pressure, confusing rewards, whales steamrolling free-to-play players, cluttered UI, and messy systems. Yep, shiny presentation, same old mobile grind, so don‚Äôt let the polished presentation fool you! It‚Äôs still a mobile monetization machine - hook, hobby, habit. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3613184962 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3613180054

To recap:
IGG=Profits at heart
As someone who had spent a substantial amount of money on the other game, Doomsday Last Survivors, what I will foresee changes that would happen in the next 1-2 years:-

1. Game is good at first, then, they will either remove the events that has very good rewards or nerf the rewards.
2. Free migration to all states for just $0.99. As a new player, you essentially only has 30 days to build up before you get state invaded and president taken away by plebs who has a 1-2 year headstart.
3. Hero armanent, hero device, pets
4. Server ping high and lags during cross-server

Look, I get it IGG is a listed, for profit company. However, the management should give the Dev team more freedom to work on instead of forcing the team to squeeze every bit of profit from players.

For point 1 & 2, I really don't get the change. Whales and non-whales have been protesting, and someone from Dev team promised to make a change, and yet the free migration problem was never solved. Of course, you will boost your short-term profit, but at what cost? Do you want to make 5k from a whale who plays only for one month or 5k plus potential another few k monthly so long the whale is happy to play on.
An extremely pay to win game, do not bother.

Nice animation and artwork. However, there isn't enough tutorial for learning. I can't find the buildings or features which I wanna build, research or progress. 
The game has been more boring as the longer time I spent playing.

This game would be more fun if the developers enabled full screen mode.
